Falls Bridge - Blue Hills Marine Environmental Research Institute click to view larger picture Blue Hill Bay side of Stevens Bridge- south side of entrance to Salt Pond. The water is fast moving as tide enters and exits. Flow of water changes direction depending on rising or falling tide. Substrate is large bounders to cobble covered with macro algae.
Eastern Point - Gloucester New England Aquarium click to view larger picture No Description available at this time.
Potter's Cover - Prudence Island W. Alton Jones Camp click to view larger picture No Description available at this time.

Science Center - Rye Seacoast Science Center click to view larger picture The Seacoast Science Center, located in historic Odiorne Point State Park in Rye, NH Site is just north of SSC building, rocky intertidal, large middle intertidal zone. Tides 8-12 feet.
South Dumpling - New York Project Oceanology click to view larger picture No Description available at this time.

Washburn Island - Vinyard Sound Waquoit Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve click to view larger picture Our study site is on the south shore of Washburn Island, mostly cobbles, fairly high energy beach, located within the Waquoit Bay National Estuarine Research Reserve, in Falmouth, MA on Vineyard Sound, on the south shore of Cape Cod. Here’s a photo that includes some of our students and leaders.

Canoe Beach Northeastern University's Marine Science Center NEW LOCATION FOR 2011 click to view larger picture Canoe Beach is located on the north side of East Point, Nahant on the property of Northeastern University's Marine Lab. We will be working on the rocks.

Cunner Ledge Northeastern University's Marine Science Center NEW LOCATION FOR 2011 click to view larger picture Cunner Ledge is located on the south side of East Point, Nahant on the property of Northeastern University's Marine Lab. We will be working on the rocks.

Meig's Point - Hammonasset State Park Mystic Aquarium NEW LOCATION FOR 2011 click to view larger picture The rocky shore area of Hammonasset State Park in Madison, CT that is just past the Meig’s point lot.
